items.title: Add Title & Description
items.description:
This is where you define what is the service/repo about, what are it's objective/aim etc. 
This will be the first thing other developers going to read, so it is very important.

items.title: Add local dev setup guide
items.description:
This is where you provide steps for dev setup.
 Any developer should be able to setup the service for development just by reading these steps. 
 This will allow other developers to collaborate faster.

items.title: Ensure your code has a good test coverage
items.description:
Having an automated way to test your code is a boon. It will help you save time and money by reducing the defect rate. 
 Your test also act as the documentation tool and defines what the code is meant to do.

items.title: Setup linters for your code base
items.description: Linters helps you in improving the code readability. It also makes your adher to a single standard.

items.title: Automate the deployments
items.description:
It is very important to deploy frequently in order to keep the deployment backlog small. 
 This helps you in isolating faults which occurs during deployment. 
 Also frequent deployments allow your to ship features/improvements to your customers faster.

items.title: Have a rollback plan
items.description: Deployments break. You should have a strategy to rollback to its initial state when that happens.

items.title: Do canary deployments
items.description: Canary deployments help you minimize the risk when your deployment breaks.
